channel.description: Recent content in Slice on tanaike

item.title: Transposing Slice From (n x m) To (m x n) for golang
item.description: Gists This is a sample script for transposing slice from (n x m) to (m x n) for golang. Script : package main import "fmt" func transpose(slice [][]string) [][]string { xl := len(slice[0]) yl := len(slice) result := make([][]string, xl) for i := range result { result[i] = make([]string, yl) } for i := 0; i < xl; i++ { for j := 0; j < yl; j++ { result[i][j] = slice[j][i] } } return result } func main() { sample := [][]string{ []string{"a1", "a2", "a3", "a4", "a5"}, []string{"b1", "b2", "b3", "b4", "b5"}, []string{"c1", "c2", "c3", "c4", "c5"}, } ar := transpose(sample) fmt.
